result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. Hoeper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 3 in case 14CF74

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.  Fees, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Bond of $500.00 applied
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine testing/PBTs as required by the agent or any law enforcement.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to commence his sentence on or before 02/21/2015 no later than 6:00 p.m.  Defendant was granted 2 days credit for time served.  Huber granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Hoeper
